info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued December 23 at 3:12AM CST until December 24 at 6:00AM CST by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST TODAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 6 AM CST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Dangerously cold wind chills values are expected this morning, ranging between -15 and -30. Starting this afternoon and through Saturday morning, wind chill values will ease, but still remain below zero. Therefore, the Wind Chill Warning will be downgraded to a Wind Chill Advisory. * WHERE...Across a large portion of Arkansas. * WHEN...The Wind Chill Warning will remain in effect through 12 PM CST Friday and then replaced by a Wind Chill Advisory that will remain in effect through 6 AM CST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: A Wind Chill Warning or Advisory means the combination of very cold air and strong winds will create dangerously low wind chill values. This will result in frost bite and lead to hypothermia or death if precautions are not taken.
